question: 際
sourceAnswer:
<read>きわ</read>|<read>ぎわ</read>:: edge/brink/verge/side | time/moment-of
<read>さい</read>:: on-the-occasion-of/circumstances/juncture
sourceMnemonic: Even though the kanji mainly means <kanji> occasion</kanji>, for some reason this word means <vocabulary>side</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>edge</vocabulary>. I suppose on <kanji>occasion</kanji> kanji takes you to the <vocabulary>edge</vocabulary> of what ought to make sense when it comes to kanji.
sourceReadingMnemonic: You're on the very <vocabulary>edge</vocabulary> of the world. You heard that at the edge of the world are the <reading>key wo</reading>rds (<ja>きわ</ja>) written there in big fiery letters, telling you the meaning of life. Supposedly these are the words of God himself. They say: "We apologize for the inconvenience." WHAT? THESE ARE THE <reading>KEY WO</reading>RDS???
